channel.title: MoparIsTheBest Banner in something new --Flash
channel.description:
Well, I hate GIF quality pictures, as they only got a 256 color pallet. But flash can do animation smoothly and still be small. I re-made it, from the actual GIF that is on top of each page. I got it to run smoothly at 50 FPS at around 31Kb, the picture on top of every page is "174.41 KB (178599 bytes)" It looks around the same, more smooth, may give a smaller tug on a Pentium 1 processor(really old, it shouldn't slow down your computer unless it is from 1994, which is what I also tested it on :P), but takes off the tug of Mopar's bandwidth. Here is the current picture: [img]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/mopar.gif[/img] And here is mine, but Mopar has flash disabled so you will have to visit yourself. here: [url=http://www.kloplop321.com/10lschuck/mopar.html]http://www.kloplop321.com/10lschuck/mopar.html[/url]
I took some work into this, report to me what you think? It is smoother, but at the same time smaller and more efficient than a GIF

item.title: MoparIsTheBest Banner in something new --Flash
item.dc:creator: @YourDistracted YourDistracted
item.description:
@YourDistracted wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:15, topic:80142”][quote author=kloplop321 link=topic=117691.msg1159214#msg1159214 date=1176626474]
I don’t see why adobe decided to buy out Macromedia though[br][size=1][/size][hr][/quote]

Why is Adobe acquiring Macromedia?
Adobe’s mission has always been to help people and businesses communicate better.
Macromedia’s mission has been to provide a rich media experience. Together, we
share a vision for the future and with the combination of the two companies—our
products, technologies and people—we will enable the creation and delivery of
compelling content and experiences across multiple operating systems, devices
and media.

Why are the companies joining now?
Both companies are experiencing great success and momentum and have great
opportunities ahead of them, and believe that together, they will be better able to
achieve their combined vision with greater synergy. We also believe the joining

Why is this good for customers?
This transaction will benefit customers across all segments the two companies serve–creative
professionals working with web, print, and video; application developers; business users
and enterprises; the mobile ecosystem, hobbyists and consumers. Combining the passion,
creativity, and operational excellence of two leading-edge companies, will allow us to better
serve customers by accelerating innovations that change the way that people everywhere are
experiencing and interacting with information.[/quote]
Thats bullshit they just want more profit assholes…

Read full topic

item.title: MoparIsTheBest Banner in something new --Flash
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

smaller too, but hopefully they just get to work on the plugin, because, this is a lot smaller, and… It would just be cool if something I made was on the top of every page. I might just make it so it would blend in with the top bar as well. But that is until later.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparIsTheBest Banner in something new --Flash
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I would just edit the display template Normally there would be text for me.
GIF doesn’t have the individual symbols and text into different layers, but just an output of it. Secondly, it really looks like flash, as the skipping units are about 95% the same.

I also don’t see what is so hard for making a 64-bit plug in…

Read full topic

item.title: MoparIsTheBest Banner in something new --Flash
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

kloplop321:

this is a customized forum, otherwise that picture wouldn’t be up there, It is all about Moding the php code. Naturally you wouldn’t even have the option of that picture up there.

The option is built into SMF to have banners up there. I am fairly certain that you could put a swf file up there with little or no problems.

kloplop321:

first of all, I didn’t have the original flash source, secondly, compare the sizes…

It was originally made with Photoshop and most likely Image Ready for the animations. Just save it to your computer and open it up with Photoshop. You can easily edit the frames and the speed of the frames. No flash about it.

Read full topic

item.description:

I knew the reason, but that was a rhetorical question. I just don’t like their new monopoly on us, go torrents (hides in corner)

item.title: MoparIsTheBest Banner in something new --Flash
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

ohh yeah, you run a 64- bit computer, I forgot about that. Well that really sucks. Sure, I will help. I don’t see why adobe decided to buy out Macromedia though… And why they can’t make a plugin for 64-bit browsers.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2007, 09:36:01 PM[/size][hr]I signed the petition, however they need to change Macromedia to Adobe.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparIsTheBest Banner in something new --Flash
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Sorry, but I am officially boycotting flash until adobe decides to get off their asses and make a flash plugin for 64-bit browsers.

If you want to help, email adobe, or sign the petition here: http://www.petitiononline.com/lin64swf/petition.html

For more info on the subject: http://www.adobe.com/go/6b3af6c9

Read full topic

Yes tweened, but all in the same area and speed, the frame rate may be off due to the fact that I stretched it out to make it more smooth, if you didn’t notice.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2007, 07:41:30 PM[/size][hr]there, just refresh it, You will now also see mopar’s pic, Compare and contrast, and report your opinion.
